newsitem.title: USA: Donna Karan has $4.8 mln cost-cutting plan.
newsitem.headline: Donna Karan has $4.8 mln cost-cutting plan.

text.p: Fashion designer Donna Karan International Inc. said Wednesday it cut its U.S. workforce by 4 percent and implemented a hiring freeze as part of a $4.8 million cost containment plan.
The job cuts and hiring freeze are expected to generate $2 million in savings in 1997, the company said in a press release announcing the restructuring plan.
That estimate does not include a one-time, pre-tax charge of $1.6 million associated with severance benefits. The charge will be recorded in the second quarter, the company said.
Donna Karan previously had planned to increase employment by 5 percent this year, it said.
Other cost-containment measures the company plans to take include:

-- Cancellation of fashion shows. The company said it will not hold runway shows scheduled for July to showcase its spring 1998 Donna Karan New York mens' and DKNY men's collections. It has also canceled plans to show the Donna Karan New York women's collection in Milan, Italy this October, but will show this collection in New York at significantly lower cost, it said.
